item.title: Report E-2024040466
item.description:
Report E-2024040466

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-24T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported a one gallon release of regulated UN1824 "Instant Power Main Line Cleaner" arrived damaged at Terminal NOF. The caller stated that a case containing four one-gallon plastic jugs were punctured by a forklift at the loading terminal. The safety data sheet was reviewed with the caller, and advised that a contractor would be needed to complete the cleanup. Hulls arrived onsire, the team will downstack the pallet and collect the impacted jugs and they will neutralize the impacted area with vinegar. All waste will be placed into poly drums. Only one 55-gallon DF of spent absorbent and debris was generated for this spill. All waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024040884
item.description:
Report X-2024040884

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: SAINT PETERSBURG
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered and placed inside in line hazardous materials bin to be taken away to a secure location for processing. DescribePack: Upon inspection of contents it was determined that one of the bottles had a loose and missing cap which resulted in 2 quarts of product being released. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined bin and taken away to a secure location for processing while remnants were cleaned up.

item.title: Report X-2024040888
item.description:
Report X-2024040888

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found wet in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: Contents were leaking from under the cap on 1 of the jerricans in the box, even though the cap was on tight. In tightening the cap further, the leakage slowed, but did not stop. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the box was placed upright into a hazbag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024040968
item.description:
Report X-2024040968

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: OCOEE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought back to facility from driver as a damage off truck. The spill happened on the truck during transport and found by the driver. After dropping it off at QA, spill was dry and was put in a container with Hazmat bag. DescribePack: Package was poorly packaged with no packing material. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The release was on truck, at end of driver route spill was dry. PPE was taken place.

item.title: Report X-2024040798
item.description:
Report X-2024040798

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-14
  • City: POMPANO BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found in the HazMat Cage during morning audit. It was not sent as hazardous but someone wrote "leaking HazMat" on the box. It was later confirmed to be hazardous. DescribePack: The plastic jug's cap was loose and leaked within the box. Bottom of the box had failed due to leakage. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Someone had already placed the box within a red tote and HazMat bag inside the HazMat Cage.

DescribePack: Upon inspecting container, it was noted the there was a crack on the bottom which caused about 4 oz. of liquid to leak out. Plastic Pail was not shipped in a fiberboard box. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: pail is inside a plastic bag in a bin, awaiting instructions from PGH.

Package was set aside and placed in a hazmat bin. DescribePack: Small puncture hole. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Ensure package stayed upright.

item.title: Report X-2024040896
item.description:
Report X-2024040896

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: PANAMA CITY
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package had gotten wet on the bottom from rain, handlers disregarded arrows and placed package upside down, and dropped the package onto the tugger where it was brought to QA. The drop caused the seals on the bottles to burst and caused the cleaner liquid to spill from the caps, package handler had liquid spill onto him. Had first aid for exposure done, no injury report filed. DescribePack: Package had orientation arrows ignored and was dropped on the wrong side, causing the liquid to break the seals within the bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a tote and placed properly following arrows, then was promptly moved into the hazardous cage for inspection.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Corrosive hazmat package was found wet. Upon inspection found 2 bottles of Flora Fresh 2.5-gallon had defective lids which resulted to leakage. The lids were secured but liquid content were still seeping through lids. DescribePack: Bottles had defective lids which resulted to leakage. The lids were secured but liquid content were still seeping through lids. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Corrosive hazmat package was found wet & torn. Upon inspection found 2 bottles of Alka-Brite condenser coil cleaner 1-gallon were crushed & had loose lids resulted to leakage. 1 bottle was packed on its side. Package was undeclared hazmat due to shipping label covering corrosive diamond label. DescribePack: Bottles were crushed & had loose lids resulted to leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024040574
item.description:
Report X-2024040574

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived already wet to the station, then it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: Both plastic bottles of Noble Chemical Power Liquid Machine Detergent leaked from loose caps. About 20 ounces were released. The caps were not secured. The shipper did not use padding and/ or inner packaging materials. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon arrival of the wet package, it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.

item.description:
Report X-2024040715

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EMPLOYEE PICKED UP PACKAGE FROM CUSTOMER WHO HAD BEEN TRYING TO SHIP HAZMATS BEFORE, EMPLOYEE ASKED RESPONDER TO OPEN THE PACKAGE TO SEE IF IT CONTAINED A HAZMAT. RESPONDER OPENED THE PACKAGE AND SAW THAT IT WAS A HAZMAT. AEROSOLS, NON-FLAMMABLE; PACKAGE COVERED IN PLASTIC WRAP AND INNER BOX MARKED WITH GROUND LTD QTY MARKING

item.title: Report X-2024040613
item.description:
Report X-2024040613

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: SAINT PETERSBURG
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived damp, showing signs of leakage. QA immediately secured package into a hazmat bag and bin to be inspected. DescribePack: Upon inspection QA found one of the 4 bottles had a loose cap, being the cause of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Product was sat upright in a secured hazmat bag and bin.

item.title: Report E-2024040378
item.description:
Report E-2024040378

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: LAKELAND
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 28, 2024, four (4) 1-gallon cans of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha-Omega Training Compliance (AOTC) to remediate the site. Crews downstacked the pallet to find the source of the release, and they found one (1) damaged cardboard box that contained four (4) 1-gallon cans had been crushed, so crews removed the box and its contents for waste. The product had leaked onto the outside of some of the other cardboard boxes, but the product had already dried. One (1) 55-gallon drum that contained the damaged cardboard box, four (4) impacted cans, and PPE was labeled and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2024040622 SequenceEvent: Package was loaded into 391 truck when the driver noticed the package was leaking. The driver immediately altered QA about the package. QA then removed the package from the loaders to be processed. DescribePack: Two of the caps of Zep Calcium, Lime & Rust Stain Remover was not tight enough and caused internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Removing the package immediately. 2. X-2024040624 SequenceEvent: Package was under the 400 belt when the package was found leaking. QA quickly found the package and removed it from the area. DescribePack: Both of the caps of Zep Industrial Purple Degreaser were not sealed tight enough and caused internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Removing the package away immediately from the PH.
